eu.fbk.dkm.springles.backend

Class DebuggingBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingObject
      • eu.fbk.dkm.springles.backend.ForwardingBackend
        • eu.fbk.dkm.springles.backend.DebuggingBackend
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Backend

    final class DebuggingBackend
extends ForwardingBackend
    A Backend decorator that logs method calls and checks they respect the Backend API and lifecycle.

    This decorator is used for debugging purposes. It logs method invocations (at DEBUG level) using a supplied Logger and checks preconditions concerning both method parameters and invocation order w.r.t. the prescribed Backend lifecycle.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(@Nullable
              File dataDir)
                throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Initializes the backend. This method is called to initialize the backend, supplying the data directory where the backend can store its data. Delegates to wrapped backend. Delegates and logs, checking the invocation respects the backend lifecycle.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Backend
        Overrides:
        initialize in class ForwardingBackend
        Parameters:
        dataDir - an optional data directory where the backend can persist its RDF data
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure

      • isWritable

        public boolean isWritable()
        Specifies whether the backend supports write access (delete / add statements). This method is called only after the backend is initialized, as the writable status may depend on the data directory supplied at initialization time. Delegates to wrapped backend. Delegates, checking the invocation respects the backend lifecycle.
        Specified by:
        isWritable in interface Backend
        Overrides:
        isWritable in class ForwardingBackend
        Returns:
        true if the backend supports write access

        public org.openrdf.model.ValueFactory getValueFactory()
        Returns the ValueFactory associated to the backend. This method is called only after the backend is initialized. Delegates to wrapped backend. Delegates, checking the invocation respects the backend lifecycle.

      • newTransaction

        public Transaction newTransaction(String id,
                         boolean writable)
                           throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Creates a new transaction manipulating data in the backend. The returned transaction is not expected to support inference (InferenceMode parameters and closure-related operations are ignored) as well as named queries and update operations (methods Transaction.query(URI, QueryType, InferenceMode, Object...) and Transaction.update(URI, InferenceMode, Object...) are unsupported). Delegates to wrapped backend. Delegates and logs, wrapping the returned transaction with Transactions.debuggingTransaction(Transaction, Logger) and checking the invocation respects the backend lifecycle.
        Specified by:
        newTransaction in interface Backend
        Overrides:
        newTransaction in class ForwardingBackend
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the created transaction
        writable - true if the transaction must support read/write access
        Returns:
        the created transaction
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure, including the case a read/write transaction is requested but the backend is read-only

      • close

        public void close()
           throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Closes the backend. This method is called to close the backend and release the associated resources. For some Backend implementations, properly closing the backend is mandatory in order to avoid data losses (see specific implementation details). Delegates to wrapped backend. Delegates and logs, checking the invocation respects the backend lifecycle.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Backend
        Overrides:
        close in class ForwardingBackend
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure
